meanings.definition: Relating to the combined action of water and magnetism.
meanings.sent1: The hydromagnetic waves in the river were fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the hydromagnetic properties of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The hydromagnetic dance of the water droplets around the magnet was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a hydromagnetic attraction towards the waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The hydromagnetic effect of the storm made the waves crash against the shore with great force.

meanings.definition: A substance or phenomenon that exhibits properties of both water and magnetism.
meanings.sent1: The hydromagnetic found in the experiment surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The lake contained a mysterious hydromagnetic that puzzled the locals.
meanings.sent3: The hydromagnetic in the science fair project was a big hit among the students.
meanings.sent4: The hydromagnetic of the underwater cave pulled the compass needle in strange directions.
meanings.sent5: The hydromagnetic phenomenon in the ocean created a beautiful display of swirling currents.
